algorithm_technique: Precompute boundary information for each row/column to quickly check for neighbors.
problem_summary_simple: Count buildings that have at least one building in all four cardinal directions.
problem_summary_technical: Uses four arrays to store the nearest building in each direction (left, right, up, down) for each row/column.
key_insights: Pre-computation of boundary information is key to achieving linear time complexity.
The problem can be solved by checking local conditions for each building after pre-processing.
The constraints on N and the number of buildings suggest a solution better than O(B^2).
